channel.title: Linux CentOS VPS - Alot of problems
channel.description:
Hello,
I have a problem with my Linux CentOS VPS, when ever I type the run command for my .sh my server does not go online. I also cant check if it is running! Because I am on putty.
Anyone that can help?
To what should my run.bat change?
Using Matrix 718/742
[code]@echo off title Server "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause[/code]

item.title: Linux CentOS VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“giveitup, post:3, topic:524129”][Launcher] Loading Cache…
[Launcher] Initiating Data Files…
[Launcher] Initiating Fishing Spots…
[Launcher] Initiating NPC Combat Scripts…
[Launcher] Initiating Dialogues…
[Launcher] Initiating Controlers…
[Launcher] Initiating Cutscenes…
[Launcher] Initiating Friend Chats Manager…
[Launcher] Initiating Cores Manager…
[Launcher] Initiating Spawned NPCs
[Launcher] Initiating Spawned Objects
[Launcher] Initiating World…
[Launcher] Initiating Region Builder…
[Launcher] Initiating Server Channel Handler…
[Launcher] Initiating Control Panel…
Exception in thread “main” java.awt.HeadlessException:
No X11 DISPLAY variable was set, but this program performed an operation which requires it.
at java.awt.GraphicsEnvironment.checkHeadless(GraphicsEnvironment.java:207)
at java.awt.Window.(Window.java:535)
at java.awt.Frame.(Frame.java:420)
at java.awt.Frame.(Frame.java:385)
at javax.swing.JFrame.(JFrame.java:174)
at com.rs.Panel.(Panel.java:58)
at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:101)[/quote]
So your server has a GUI. Which isn’t going to run on a headless VPS. Either destroy it or add a check before trying to open it up.

Read full topic
item.source: Linux CentOS VPS - Alot of problems

item.title: Linux CentOS VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

You can redirect your standard output to a file, which is better anyway for this kind of thing.

nohup ./run > /path/to/outputfile.out &

simple.

Read full topic

Nothing wrong with nohup if you don’t need stdout

facepalm

item.title: Linux CentOS VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Someone not using a Windows VPS??? O.O

First, make sure java is actually installed:

Make sure no java process is running:

That should do nothing, otherwise you might get something like this if there already is a java process running:

take note of the number you get on the left and then do:

Where XXX is that number, in my case it would be 14376. Skip that if you didn’t get anything in the previous step. Now put this in your shell script:

#!/bin/bash java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -Xmx512m -cp bin:lib/* com.rs.Launcher true true false

Then do:

Replace “run.sh” with whatever you named your script to, then simply do the following command to run your server:

Again, replace “run.sh” in the above with the name of your script, but DO NOT remove the “./” part just before the name. That should run your server in the background so that you can safely close putty without shutting down your server. You must always run it that way, or your server will shut itself off when you close putty. Now to check if the server is running, you just do this command:

and if you get something like:

Then it is. To kill the service, assuming you don’t have a shutdown/update command in game, just do:

Where XXX is the left-most number in the output you get from the command you ran previously.

Read full topic
